Title.evidence: Randomised Controlled Trial on Cardioprotective Strategies in Cardioplegic Solutions

Trial_Design.evidence: randomised controlled trial included adult patients undergoing cardiac surgery with cardioplegia

Participants.evidence: Conducted at a cardiovascular surgery center... Eligibility criteria encompassed individuals with cardiovascular pathologies

Intervention.evidence: Participants were randomised into two groups: intervention (cardioplegic solution with adjuvants) and control (standard cardioplegic solution)

Objective.evidence: To evaluate the impact of adjuvant-enhanced cardioplegic solutions on myocardial protection

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was the extent of myocardial damage, assessed by cardiac biomarkers, over a 48-hour postoperative period

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Randomisation was computer-generated, and allocation was concealed using sealed envelopes

Blinding.evidence: Blinding was applied to outcome assessors

Number_Randomised.evidence: A total of 200 participants were randomised, 100 to each group, between January 2020 and June 2021

Number_Analysed.evidence: Analysis included 98 in the intervention group and 97 in the control group, using an intention-to-treat approach

Result_Outcome.evidence: The intervention group demonstrated a significant reduction in myocardial damage (mean difference = 5.2, 95% CI 3.1 to 7.3; p = 0.01)

Harms.evidence: Adverse events were mild, with 3% in the intervention group and 1% in the control group experiencing side effects

Funding.evidence: This trial was funded by the National Institute of Health
